newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: ICI slides at open on parent exit news.
newsitem.headline: ICI slides at open on parent exit news.

text.p: The shares of ICI Australia Ltd opened sharply weaker on Thursday after Britain's Imperial Chemical Industries Plc announced on Wednesday it would sell its 62.4 percent stake in the company.
At 10.05 a.m (0005 GMT), ICI Australia shares were A$1.544 or 12.4 percent weaker at A$10.90 on turnover of 36,127 shares.
"The announcement has come as a bit of a shock to the market which was pricing in a possible parent buy-out rather than sell-out," a Melbourne-based dealer said.
ICI said on Wednesday it intended to sell its ICI Australia stake to help it purchase Unilever Plc/NV's speciality chemicals business for US$8 billion.
ICI Australia's financial advisor on the sale, Centaurus Corporate Finance has said the stake is likely to be sold in two tranches to institutions in Australia, Europe, the United States and Asia.
At a price of A$10.80, ICI's 185 million share stake is worth about A$2.01 billion.
